metadata.title: CVE-2016-10741 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 4.9.3, fs/xfs/xfs_aops.c allows local users tocause a denial of service (system crash) because there is a race conditionbetween direct and memory-mapped I/O (associated with a hole) that ishandled with BUG_ON instead of an I/O failure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10741` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-96-generic - 4.4.0-96.119~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-96-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-96.119~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-96-lowlatency - 4.4.0-96.119~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-96-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-96.119~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-96-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-96.119~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-96-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-96.119~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-96-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-96.119~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-96-generic - 4.4.0-96.119~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').

linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-96.119~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
